thread.title: Distinguished Performance Not Online in Marxist Lands

author: wsjcom
title: Distinguished Performance Not Online in Marxist Lands
text:
In his well-judged critique of the misuse of the term “distinguished,” Stephen Miller omits an important point in “Can a Marxist Critic Be ‘Distinguished’?” (op-ed, Feb. 13). By any military standard Terry Eagleton deserves a DMC (Distinguished Marxist Cross) for his role in the battle against the much-loved English poet Philip Larkin.
Leading a small platoon of Larkin critics and former Larkin friends, Prof. Eagleton exposes the Thatcher-loving bard’s ruthless efforts to amuse and instruct his readers by expressing the very...
